intro: Impatiens palniensis, commonly known as the Palni impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous perennial species belonging to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae. The plant features showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically red or orange in color, with five petals and a spurred lower petal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its seeds are dispersed by the explosive mechanism typical of the genus, aiding in its propagation within its native habitat.
